title: Cannot select default connection file on startup
author: David-Houser
body_snippet:
I am unable to select a default connection file to open on startup.

I have tried adding the /c: and /cons: parameters, but these do not work.

“C:\Program Files (x86)\mRemoteNG\mRemoteNG.exe” /c:”C:\OneDrive\path\to\config.xml"

There does not seem be an option for this in the mRemote application.

Am I missing something? Is this possible in the current version? I'm using build 1.77.3 (Nightly Build; 1784)

Thank you,

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet: Version 1.77.3-nb does not save settings as it's disabled due to development process in the settings saving section. If you want persistent settings, you currently have to use 1.77.2-nb.

comments.author: matthewb47
comments.snippet:
This is a kludge, but it works.

Rename or delete the default confCons.xml file in your default mRemote directory.

Then setup a symbolic link of "confCons.xml" with the mklink command or other methods to your real/target .xml configuration file.

https://www.howtogeek.com/16226/complete-guide-to-symbolic-links-symlinks-on-windows-or-linux/

mRemote will now load with the proper data.
